intro: Myostemma mendocinensis, commonly known as the Mendocino myostem, is a rare flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
